entry.title: Kyutei Omuro・旧邸御室
entry.content:
Kyutei Omuro is a traditional Japanese mansion, built in 1937. While most people shoot this scene straight on with a reflection of the garden on the polished wood table, I prefer this angled shot that shows more of the room itself.

1937年に建てられた日本の伝統的な邸宅である旧邸御室。多くの人はこのシーンを真正面から撮影し、磨き上げられた木のテーブルに庭が映るように撮影しますが、私は部屋そのものをより多く見せるこのアングルのショットを好みます。
entry.summary: Kyutei Omuro is a traditional Japanese mansion, built in 1937. While most people shoot this scene straight on with a reflection of the garden on the polished wood table, I prefer this angled shot that shows more of the room itself.

entry.title: Saga Matsuri・嵯峨祭
entry.content:
Today was the Saga Matsuri, a Japanese festival in the Saga area, north of Arashiyama. Several portable shrines with a local deity inside (mikoshi) are taken out and carried around the neighborhood. Many residents and businesses offer drinks: water, sake, beer, tea; and in gratitude the members perform a dance with the shrine, rocking it back and forth and generally making a lot of exuberant noise.

今日は嵐山で嵯峨祭がありました。地元の神様を祀った神輿を数基持ち出し、近所を練り歩きます。 多くの住民や企業が水、酒、ビール、お茶などの飲み物を提供し、感謝の気持ちを込めて神輿を上下に揺らしながら踊りを披露し、大いに盛り上がる。

Several portable shrines with a local deity inside (mikoshi) are taken out and carried around the neighborhood. Many residents and businesses offer drinks: water, sake, beer, tea; and in gratitude the members perform a dance with the shrine, rocking it back and forth and generally making a lot of exuberant noise.

entry.title: Keyaki Bridge・欅橋
entry.content:
Wandered around inside the Kyoto Imperial Palace grounds for the first time in almost 10 years. The palace itself (The Emperor‘s Kyoto residence) is set inside the Palace Park. A tour reservation used to be required to visit, but now the palace grounds can be entered without either a reservation or tour.

Above is the Keyakibashi Bridge: a small footbridge within the Oikeniwa pond garden. Below, some other photos of the palace grounds.

約10年ぶりに京都御所の敷地内をぶらぶらしました。京都御所（天皇陛下のお住まい）は、御所公園内にあります。以前はツアーの予約が必要でしたが、今は予約もツアーもなく、敷地内に入ることができます。

上の写真は、御池庭園の中にある小さな歩道橋「欅橋」です。以下、御所地内の他の写真。

Above is the Keyakibashi Bridge: a small footbridge within the Oikeniwa pond garden. Below, some other photos of the palace grounds.

entry.title: Oi River・大堰川
entry.content:
Came out after the rain and was treated to blue skies with big white clouds. I was able to get the clouds to reflect in the river by walking out onto the exposed riverbed.

雨上がりに出てみると、青空に大きな白い雲を見ることができました。川底を歩いて、雲を川に映すことができた。
